Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google Inc. know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google Inc. 's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. effort to speed up the decision-making within the company. Eric Schmidt has also drafted a plan to sell some of the stock he holds in the company. The news surfaced in a regulatory filing last week. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. Eric Schmidt holds 9.2 million shares of Google stock and has 9.6% of the company's voting power according to Reuters. He plans to sell 534,000 shares of Class A common stock--
